title: Advanced Logic
author: Prof. Blockworth
pages: Logic gates are the building bricks of complex redstone circuits.
The basic types are AND, OR, NOT, NOR, NAND, XOR, and XNOR.
Each gate manipulates input signals to produce a desired output.
An AND gate requires both inputs to be 'on' for the output to activate.
Use a NOT gate to invert a signal, turning 'on' to 'off' or vice versa.
Experiment by using combinations of gates to create automated systems.
